titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Kenneth Walter Cameron Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 08:17

did.unittitle: Kenneth Walter Cameron papers

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of autographs and collected letters, sermons, teaching materials, research notes and documents, and the typescript of Kenneth Cameron's master's thesis on Othello (1931). A large part of the papers relates to the Church of the Holy Trinity in Hartford, Connecticut and contains a substantial collection of the sermons, writings and speeches of the Reverend Ernest Fremery Miel, manuscripts of Sir Arthur Gorges, sermons of Joseph G. H. Barry and papers relating to the construction of the church, 1870-1874. Also in the papers are a number of Civil War documents, including papers of P. P. Pitkin and letters to the U. S. Treasury from officers of the U. S. Colored Regiments. Another group of letters, written between 1885 and 1917, to Samuel Hart, concerns the American Book of Common Prayer. Also included are research materials on the Concord School of Philosophy and Literature.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The sealed containers of Cameron letters and miscellany are unprocessed and may contain sensitive information or be in a physical state that would prohibit use. Researchers wishing to request access should email mssa.assist@yale.edu requesting specific box numbers in order to initiate the review process, which may take several weeks.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Kenneth Walter Cameron Papers (MS 124). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Kenneth W. Cameron, 1936, 1960 onward; gift of the University of Connecticut, 2000.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of autographs and collected letters, sermons, teaching materials, research notes and documents, and the typescript of Kenneth Cameron's master's thesis on Othello (1931). A large part of the papers relates to the Church of the Holy Trinity in Hartford, Connecticut and contains a substantial collection of the sermons, writings and speeches of the Reverend Ernest Fremery Miel, manuscripts of Sir Arthur Gorges, sermons of Joseph G. H. Barry and papers relating to the construction of the church, 1870-1874. Also in the papers are a number of Civil War documents, including papers of P. P. Pitkin and letters to the U. S. Treasury from officers of the U. S. Colored Regiments. Another group of letters, written between 1885 and 1917, to Samuel Hart, concerns the American Book of Common Prayer. Also included are research materials on the Concord School of Philosophy and Literature.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Kenneth Walter Cameron was born on October 12, 1908, in Martins Ferry, Ohio. He received a B.A. degree (1930) and a M.A. degree (1931) from West Virginia University, a S.T.B. from General Theological Seminary (1935), and a Ph.D. from Yale (1940). Cameron was ordained an Episcopal priest in 1935. He taught English at the University of North Carolina (1938-1943), Temple University (1945-1946), and Trinity College (1946-until retirement). Cameron also served as the archivist and historiographer for the Diocese of Connecticut.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown, though much of the material in this collection is likely in the public domain. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

unittitle.title: Middletown, Conn. Church of the Holy Trinity

did.unittitle: Papers of the Church of the Holy Trinity, Middletown, Conn. Relate to the construction of the church, 1870-1874; include correspondence, contracts, estimates, invoices, receipts, legal papers, etc. The following correspondents are represented: George D. Hooper, Dr. Joseph w. Alsop, Robert G. Pike, Henry Dudley, A. Putnam and others.
Five looseleaf notebooks of typewritten sermons
Correspondence , filed chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 envelopes of mss. etc. relating to Sir Arthur Gorges. Includes the following:
Hartford, Conn. Trinity Church. Miscellaneous papers found in the Parish House with papers of E. deF. Miel.
Announcement of the coming of the Rev. Raymond Cunningham as Associate to the Rector, Trinity Episcopal Church. List of gifts and memorials and names of contributors, 1905.
List of gifts and memorials, typed and proofread.
List of names and addresses of people to whom "List of gifts and memorials" were sent
Outline of program for teaching 1st, 2nd 3rd grades
Plea for Easter offerings.
"Santa Claus"—a play
Subscription books new organ
Miscellaneous material: clippings
Commentary on the T.M.C.A. and other philanthropic activities

odd.p: "The Church in its relation to the living Christ."

odd.p: Drawing book and autograph album with drawings laid in or sketched in.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Two sermons sewed together preached in Houghton, Whitb, Weremouth, etc. England, 1727 1743/44

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Ethics, I. Typewritten transcripts of lectures by H.P. Perkins, ca. 1932-1933

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 16 documents of the Civil War period to P.P. Pitkin of the Assistant Quartermaster's Office. 10 requisitions for stores, 1863-1864, drawn ON Col. Pitkin and receipted by various officers at Brandy Station, Warrenton Junction, and other points in Virginia; 2 letters to Col. Pitkin, 1863-1864, from officers in the Asst. Quartermaster's Department; 4 U.S. military telegrams to Col. Pitkin, Oct, 1863 from various officers at Headquarters, Army of the Potomac.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: "Robert Browning", typed essay, Aug 13, 1941. Probably a student of Mr. Cameron in North Carolina.

scopecontent.head: General note
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous notes, deeds, and other legal papers and documents connected with the Mabis and Eckhart families of Wheeling, West Virginia. 1865-1918.
The Presbury Family of Maryland and the Ohio Valley, 2 vols.
Genalogical data on the Alsop, Scovill, Terrell and Williams Families.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Othello, a re-examination of the quarto of 1622. A comparative textual study. A thesis…for degree of Master of Arts, West Virginia, June 1931. Typescript.
